title.native: 美少女戦士セーラームーンCosmos 後編
title.romaji: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon: Cosmos - Kouhen
title.english: Pretty Guardian Sailor Moon Cosmos The Movie: Part 2

description:
Sailor Moon battles Shadow Galactica, an enemy threatening her friends in order to rule the universe. Can she protect her loved ones and persevere?

(Source: Netflix Anime)
hashtag: #劇場版セーラームーン #美少女戦士セーラームーン
synonyms: Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon Cosmos Part 2

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

node.description: Naoko Takeuchi is a manga artist who lives in Tokyo, Japan. Takeuchi's works are widely admired by anime/manga fans. She is a well-known mangaka in the United States. Her most popular work, Sailor Moon, has been widely reprinted and marketed in North America. She also wrote the lyrics for a number of songs featured in the Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon anime and live-action series. They are mainly character-based image songs, but do include a few theme songs. She has won several awards including the 2nd Nakayoshi Comic Prize for Newcomers, for “Yume ja Nai no Ne,” in 1985. She also won for "Love Call" which won Nakayoshi's New Artist award which debuted in the Nakayoshi Deluxe September 1986 issue. In 1993 she won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for shoujo for Sailor Moon. She is also married to the author of Hunter x Hunter and Yu Yu Hakusho, [Togashi Yoshihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96893).

On rare occasions he animates on the shows in which he works.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/257398/)._

Naoko Takeuchi is a manga artist who lives in Tokyo, Japan. Takeuchi's works are widely admired by anime/manga fans. She is a well-known mangaka in the United States. Her most popular work, Sailor Moon, has been widely reprinted and marketed in North America. She also wrote the lyrics for a number of songs featured in the Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon anime and live-action series. They are mainly character-based image songs, but do include a few theme songs. She has won several awards including the 2nd Nakayoshi Comic Prize for Newcomers, for “Yume ja Nai no Ne,” in 1985. She also won for "Love Call" which won Nakayoshi's New Artist award which debuted in the Nakayoshi Deluxe September 1986 issue. In 1993 she won the 17th Kodansha Manga Award for shoujo for Sailor Moon. She is also married to the author of Hunter x Hunter and Yu Yu Hakusho, [Togashi Yoshihiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96893).

[Website](http://daoko.jp/) | [Blog](http://daoko.life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daok0) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daoko_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIzc1_X3OAFquArF3EOVeWw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/daok0) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@daoko.official) __Introduction:__ DAOKO is a Japanese female vocalist, rapper and lyricist. She first gained popularity in 2012, at the age of 15, when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention. Biography: DAOKO released her first album, *"Hyper Girl: Mukougawa no Onna no Ko"* in December 2012 through *Low High Who? Production*. In December 2013 she released a sophomore album titled *"GRAVITY"*. She received a lot of attention for her collaboration with TeddyLoid for *"Me!Me!Me!"* (a song featured in an animated short for [Nihon Animator Mihonichi](https://anilist.co/anime/20947)) in November 2014. DAOKO was nominated for Next Break Artist at the MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2015. DAOKO left *Low High Who? Production* after releasing her album *"Dimension"* in February 2015, and subsequently shut down her blog. She released her self-titled album *"DAOKO"* via *Toy's Factory* a month later. DAOKO started her first tour in January 2016. In December 2017 she released the album *"THANK YOU BLUE"*. In December 2018 she released *"私的旅行 (Shiteki Ryouko)"*. In October 2019 she collaborated with mobile game *Dragalia Lost* to release *"DAOKO×Dragalia Lost"*. DAOKO's 2017 single *"Uchiage Hanabi"* for Studio Shaft's anime movie [Uchiage Hanabi, Shita kara Miru ka? Yoko kara Miru ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/97908) is the most viewed anime song on YouTube, with over 400 million views. She won the *2018 Space Shower Music Award* in the Song of the Year category for *"Uchiage Hanabi"*, and in the Best Breakthrough Artist category. In July 2020 she released the album *"anima"*.

__[Website](https://www.agraph.jp/)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/4L0gz16xuM1as1OgYzh1SR)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/agraph)__

Kensuke Ushio, alternatively known by stage name agraph, is a Japanese musician, DJ, composer, arranger, programmer, remixer and member of rock band [Lama](http://www.sonymusic.co.jp/artist/lama/profile/).

When he was a child Kensuke learned to play the piano, while later at University he started studying arts and music, in addition to also learning how to use audio editing software like Pro Tools. At the age of 20, Kensuke first came in contact with the electronic music world known as techno. 

In 2007, he would start his solo career under the stage name agraph, this is when he started to create his own electronic music. His debut album titled A Day, Phases, produced by Takkyu Ishino, was released in December of 2008. Skipping to 2010, he would release his second album titled Equal which managed to rank in the Japanese Albums Charts.

In 2011, Kensuke and former musicians from the bands Supercar and Number Girl formed a rock band called Lama. The band has released two albums, which both managed to rank in the official Albums Charts of Japan.  It was later revealed that due to his involvement in the rock band Lama, he wouldn't be able to release a third album until 6 years after his second album. His third album titled The Shader was released in 2016.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Website](http://daoko.jp/) | [Blog](http://daoko.life/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/daok0) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/daoko_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIzc1_X3OAFquArF3EOVeWw) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/daok0) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@daoko.official) __Introduction:__ DAOKO is a Japanese female vocalist, rapper and lyricist. She first gained popularity in 2012, at the age of 15, when one of her uploaded videos on Nico Nico Douga received attention. DAOKO was nominated for Next Break Artist at the MTV Video Music Awards Japan 2015. DAOKO left *Low High Who? Production* after releasing her album *"Dimension"* in February 2015, and subsequently shut down her blog. She released her self-titled album *"DAOKO"* via *Toy's Factory* a month later. DAOKO started her first tour in January 2016. In December 2017 she released the album *"THANK YOU BLUE"*. In December 2018 she released *"私的旅行 (Shiteki Ryouko)"*. In October 2019 she collaborated with mobile game *Dragalia Lost* to release *"DAOKO×Dragalia Lost"*. DAOKO's 2017 single *"Uchiage Hanabi"* for Studio Shaft's anime movie [Uchiage Hanabi, Shita kara Miru ka? Yoko kara Miru ka?](https://anilist.co/anime/97908) is the most viewed anime song on YouTube, with over 400 million views. She won the *2018 Space Shower Music Award* in the Song of the Year category for *"Uchiage Hanabi"*, and in the Best Breakthrough Artist category. In July 2020 she released the album *"anima"*.

[Instagram](https://instagram.com/florapaulita) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/florapaulita) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/florapaulita)

Flora Paulita Martins, better known only as Flora Paulita, is a Brazilian actress, voice actress and dubbing director. She is also the younger sister of the voice actress [Agatha Paulita](https://anilist.co/staff/116185/).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Ariana Grande, Sofia Carson and Lana Condor  (Most of the productions)
- Neeko (League of Legends; where she also does the original voice of the character)
- Amity Blight (The Owl House)
- Pacifica Northwest (Gravity Falls; 2nd voice)
- Brigitte (Overwatch 1&2)
- Pony Head (Star vs. the Forces of Evil)
- Holy Serenity (Grand Chase: Dimensional Chaser)
- Kara (Detroit: Become Human)
- J (Murder Drones)
- Maddy Cho (Marvel's Avengers)
- Anabella (Doki)
- Tassia (Dragon Age: Absolution)
!~
